description: From French récidivisme, from Latin recidīvus (“returning, recurring”). Compare recidivous, -ism.

entries.meaning: Committing new offenses after a crime committed in the past.
examples: The increase in criminal activity was attributed to recidivism.

entries.meaning: (psychology, psychiatry) Chronic repetition of criminal or other antisocial behavior.
(by extension) Returning to a negative behavior after having stopped it for a period of time.
